details.description: Open Data Maturity Assessment Tool naming competition
details.content:
This competition has now closed.

The Open Data Maturity Model project is offering you a chance to name the new online assessment tool being created in partnership with Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs (Defra) for use by all.

Funded by the Release of Data Fund, the ODI and Defra is producing a simple tool to enable organisations to assess their effectiveness at publishing and consuming open data. Developed from the Open Data Maturity Model, the tool will provide a simple scorecard and recommended areas of improvement.

To enter, simply [email your suggestion](mailto:odmat@theodi.org?subject=ODMAT naming competition) to [odmat@theodi.org](mailto:odmat@theodi.org?subject=ODMAT naming competition). The winning name will be selected by a panel of the Open Data Maturity Model project team.

The competition winner will be announced at the end of March before launching the online tool.

So what’s in it for me?

In addition to naming the tool that will be widely used by open data practitioners across the UK, the winner will receive a £50 gift voucher for a retailer of their choice.

Entry details

  • Entries will be accepted from 00:01 on Monday, 9 March 2015, to 18:00 on Friday, 13 March 2015.
  • Email your suggestion to [odmat@theodi.org](mailto:odmat@theodi.org?subject=ODMAT naming competition) with your full name and contact number.
  • The winning name will be selected by our panel of judges consisting of representatives from both Defra and the ODI.
  • Due to the anticipated volume of entries received, only the successful entrant will be informed ahead of any announcement within the public domain.
  • The competition winner will be announced on the ODI and Defra websites during the week commencing 16 March 2015. More details will be announced soon.

Terms and conditions

  1. The promoter of this competition is Open Data Institute Limited of 65 Clifton Street, London EC2A 4JE.

  2. The naming competition is open to the UK. The judging panel, the staff at the Open Data Institute Limited and their family members are not permitted to enter this competition.

  3. You may only submit your suggested name by email to [odmat@theodi.org](mailto:odmat@theodi.org?subject=ODMAT naming competition). Any other form of submission will not be considered.

  4. There is no limitation to the amount of entries per person however we require each entry to be submitted separately.

  5. When submitting your suggestion, you must include your first name and surname, and the body copy of your email must include your name and contact details.

  6. If you have any questions, please email us at [odmat@theodi.org](mailto:odmat@theodi.org?subject=ODMAT naming competition) with ‘ODMAT naming competition” in the subject line.

  7. Any suggestion submitted must be your own idea, must not be copied and must not contain obscene or defamatory language, or in breach of any applicable legislation or regulations. If Open Data Institute Limited has reason to believe your entry is not your own work or otherwise breaches this rule, your entry will NOT be considered.

  8. The submission of entries for the competition opens at 00:01 on Monday, 9 March 2015 and closes on 18:00 on Friday, 13 March 2015. Entries received after 18:00 on Friday, 13 March 2015 will not be considered.

  9. The winning name will be selected by our panel of judges consisting of representatives from both Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs and Open Data Institute Limited.

  10. In submitting your entry, you agree that in the event yours is the winner, the Open Data Institute will retain ownership of copyright and other Intellectual Property rights in your entry.

  11. You grant Open Data Institute Limited the right to use your personal name for the sole purpose of identifying you as the author of the chosen name and/or as a winner of the competition when announced in marketing material.

  12. Prizes are as stated and no cash or other alternative can be offered.

  13. No responsibility is taken for lost, delayed, misdirected or incomplete entries. Proof of delivery of the entry is not proof of receipt.

  14. No purchase is necessary.

  15. Open Data Institute Limited shall not be liable for any loss, damage or injury of any nature caused, sustained by any entrant under this promotion. However, nothing in these rules shall have the effect of excluding or restricting liability for personal injury, death, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation caused by the proven negligence of employees or agents of Open Data Institute Limited.

  16. These rules are governed by the laws of England and Wales and any dispute in relation to them shall be subject to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the English courts.

  17. This competition is owned and run by Open Data Institute Limited and all competition terms and conditions are bound by Open Data Institute Limited rules.

  18. By submitting the name you are accepting these rules.
